Key Match Events: Javier Aguirre’s third stint in charge of the Mexico Men’s National Team began with a statement 3-0 win over New Zealand.
Orbelin Pineda scored the first goal for Mexico in the 5th minute.
Cesar Huerta doubled the lead with a right-footed shot shortly after being substituted in the second half.
Luis Romo scored Mexico’s third goal with a shot from outside the box.
New Zealand registered their first effort on target in the 70th minute via Matthew Garbett.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at the Rose Bowl.
Key players like Guillermo Ochoa, Edson Álvarez, Raúl Jiménez, and Hirving “Chucky” Lozano were not on the roster.
Mexico dominated the match with 13 shots to New Zealand’s two.
